name: Bard

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Weaver of tales. With their magical melodies, Bards are the heart and soul of every adventure. While wizards use hard-won knowledge and Druids use the power of nature, Bard's channel the power of pure charisma to author the world around them. Bards take the roll of support caster, shaking the resolve of enemies and shaping the face of the battlefield. Many bards are the face of their adventuring party, using their wit and tact to expertly navigate social situations.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: A bard's magic can be invaluable when adventuring. Spells like Conjure Illusion and Disguise, and Hypnotize can help a party get out of sticky situations, while Commune with the Dead can provide important answers. Like most mages, many bards leave feats of strength to the martial classes, but it is not out of the ordinary for a highly dextrous bard to sneak into danger alongside the party rogue.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Bards shine in social situations. With their expertise in charisma, and arsenal of spells such as Suggestion and Languages, they are able to glean important information and cut to the heart of the matter. Some bards travel town to town and leave a string of heartbroken lovers in their wake, while others climb to the highest echelons of society.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Bards are capable support casters. Spells like Dissonant Melody, Slow, and Rend Defenses allow them to weaken their enemies, while Song of Haste, and Take Courage empower their allies. They also make adept healers when a cleric isn't available, casting spells like Song of Slow Healing and Song of Mass Healing. While their damage output may not match wizards or warlocks, spells like Biting Words and Belch Flame are still formidable, and the Bard's versitility is second to none.

handbook.title: Charisma Caster
handbook.text: Bards are showman at heart, dashing and quick of wit. At the start of your journey, you can declare that you are a Charisma Caster. From that point on, Charisma rather than Intelligence affects your maximum action points and informal magic.

expertise: As a bard, your raw charisma is second to none. Take expertise in all charisma checks. Further, take expertise in any checks made to perform for others and in all attempts at sleight of hand.

Tier_1.name: Trick up Your Sleeve
Tier_1.description: Your sleeve contains a small pocket dimension, capable of holding up to one cubic foot of material. Once you've hidden something up your sleeve, only you may retrieve it. If you fall unconcious or die, anything hidden in your sleeve instantly pops out.
Tier_1.upcast: You can spend an action point on this spell to summon up to one hundred feet of tied together cloths from your sleeve. The cloths are bound tightly enough that they are able to hold the weight of an average sized humanoid.

Tier_1.name: Imitate
Tier_1.description: Magic suffuses your voice as you perfectly copy a sound. For the spell's duration, you are able to flawlessly mimic voices and sounds that you have heard before.

Tier_1.name: Suggestion
Tier_1.description: Your honeyed words become laced with irresistible magic as you speak earnestly to your target. They must make an spell power save or believe the next ten words that that leave your mouth. They are able to reassess their feelings if they are presented with facts to the contrary. In such a case, they may repeat their save at disadvantage.

Tier_1.name: Compulsion
Tier_1.description: As you lay eyes on a creature, mutter a spell meant to compel them to action.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw, or have an incredibly strong urge to perform a simple action of your choice. For example, you might compel a guard to walk away, or a creature to move away from you in combat. When in combat, the compulsion must be able to be completed in a single movement or in a single action.

Tier_1.name: Conjure Illusion
Tier_1.description: At the wave of your hand, the air shimmers and a magical mirage appears. You are able to conjure a static illusory image of the size of a horse or smaller. To all those who see it, the object appears to be present, though upon further inspection it is ethereal.
Tier_1.upcast: You can spend an additional action point to create a programmed illusion which has both weight and texture, and which can be capable of movement and speech. When you create such an illusion, you may establish up to five responses that it is capable of making. You must give it a script and directions regarding how and where it should move. The programmed illusion is not sentient, and cannot make decisions for itself.

Tier_1.name: Kiss and Tell
Tier_1.description: As you place a kiss on a creature, you mark them so that you always know where they are within one hundred feet. This effect fades after the spell's duration.

Tier_1.name: Dazzling Lights
Tier_1.description: As you clap your hands, seven dazzling orbs of light appear in the air around you. Each gives off light equivalent to a torch. For the spell's duration, you may order them to go anywhere within the spell's radius.

Tier_1.name: Animal Aptitude
Tier_1.description: Your magic has granted you an affinity over woodland creatures. Small animals love and follow you, and all animals tend to obey your commands and work to keep you happy and safe. This does not include monsterous animals. Whenever you perform an animal handling check, add your expertise.
Tier_1.upcast: You may additionally spend an action point to give a friendly animal a specific order. Such an order may include asking it to trail someone, attempt to open a door, go for help, or any other reasonable task that can be performed in one hour or less and is in line with the intelligence and skill of the animal.

Tier_1.name: Song of Slow Healing
Tier_1.description: Your voice fills the air in a soothing melody, and a gentle wave of magic washes over your target. As seconds pass, their wounds slowly start to heal over, and their vitality is restored.

Tier_1.name: Languages
Tier_1.description: At your command, a bead of magic embeds itself in the mind of your target. It grows and twists, entangling itself in their consciousness and granting them the ability to speak and understand any language for the spell's duration.

Tier_1.name: Hypnotize
Tier_1.description: Focus your intent upon your target and deftly begin to swing a trinket.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to extend the save to once per hour.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or their eyes slowly glaze over as they fall under your spell and become Charmed.
effect.save: The spell's victim may repeat its save once every ten minutes or whenever it is injured.

Tier_1.name: Power Chord
Tier_1.description: A pulse of sonic energy streaks from you in all directions. The wall of force parts around your allies and strikes your foes.

effect.description: Enemy's struck by the spell must make a spell power save or be pushed back fifteen feet and be Staggered.

Tier_1.name: Biting Words
Tier_1.description: As you utter an insult laced with magical power, a set of ethereal teeth appear beside your enemy and attempt to bite them.
Tier_1.upcast: For every action point spent on this spell, increase its range by 60ft.

effect.description: If your target is fully struck, they must make a spell power save or be Grappled regardless of size. You must use concentration to maintain this grapple. Damage is repeated at the end of each of the target's turns if it is still grappled.

Tier_1.name: Swarm of Squirrels
Tier_1.description: Seemingly from nowhere, hundreds of squirrels pour out of every nook and cranny around you. Good God! They're _everywhere!_ And these vicious beasts are yours to command! May they lay your enemies low!

Tier_1.name: Disguise
Tier_1.description: With a whispered incantation, you cloak your true form in a shimmering veil of illusion so that you look like someone else. You must appear humanoid and be within one foot of your current height. Your disguise can include a new wardrobe. Magical alterations are ethereal and do not hold up to physical inspection.

Tier_1.name: Silence
Tier_1.description: Holding your magic, you speak the celestial word for 'Silence.' At once, the world mutes itself as though you are underwater. No sound may be produced within the spell's radius.

effect.description: Enemies within the spell's radius are considered Muted.

Tier_1.name: Blocking Hand
Tier_1.description: As an enemy bears down on you, summon an unseen force of protection as a reaction. The attacker must make a spell power save. On failure, their attack misses. On success, it deals half damage.

Tier_1.name: Haste
Tier_1.description: Your voice rises in a quickening tempo as you urge your target forward.

effect.description: Blood pounds in their ears as they are filled with incredible energy. For the spell's duration, they are affected by the Hastened condition.

Tier_1.name: Take Courage
Tier_1.description: With a battle cry, you summon the spirit of bravery.

effect.description: In a way of your choosing, she bolsters the courage of everyone within the spell's radius, rendering them Fearlesss and granting them +2 to spell power saves for the spell's duration.

Tier_1.name: Restoration
Tier_1.description: Closing your eyes, you channel healing magic into the space around you. Any allies within the spell's radius may immediately remake a failed saving throw at advantage. This spell does not affect death coin flips, curses, or certain villain abilities.

Tier_1.name: Slow
Tier_1.description: As you touch your magic, your next word comes slowly as though stretched over time. Like honey, it drips over your target.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or be Slowed by the soothing cadence of your speech.
effect.save: The spell's victim may repeat its save at the end of each of its turns or once every five minutes when out of combat.

Tier_1.name: Raucous Laughter
Tier_1.description: You fire off a quip or joke laced with magic power.

effect.description: Your target must make a spell power save or fall to the ground in laughter and be Incapacitated.
effect.save: The spell's victim may repeat its save at the end of each of its turns or every five minutes when out of combat. The effect ends instantly if they are injured.

Tier_1.name: Distract
Tier_1.description: Use your magic to project your voice into an enemy's ears.

effect.description: At the start of each turn, the target must make a spell power save or be Distracted.

Tier_1.name: Breathe Fire
Tier_1.description: Magical warmth floods into your stomach before bubbling up and out. You belch a cone of fire, igniting anything before you.
Tier_1.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, increase its range by 10 feet.

effect.description: Anyone touched by your flames must make a spell power save or begin Burning.

Tier_1.name: Inanimate Aid
Tier_1.description: In a clattering chorus, every inanimate object within range of you comes to life. As one, they throw themselves at enemies in a radius of your choosing.
Tier_1.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, increases its damage by 2d4

Tier_1.name: Immovable
Tier_1.description: With unwavering focus, you channel your energy into an unyielding force that anchors a chosen object in place. The object must be smaller than a wagon, and cannot be a living creature. The spell ends if you move further than the radius from the object or if you lose concentration on it.

Tier_1.name: Wall of Sound
Tier_1.description: As you strike a note, a 5x5x1 foot wall of sound bursts into existence at a point within range. The wall is impassible, and serves as cover for anyone behind it.
Tier_1.upcast: You can spend an additional action point on the spell to increase the size of the wall to 15x5x1 feet.

Tier_2.name: Invisible Servant
Tier_2.description: With a snap of your fingers, you summon an invisible servant to aid you. The servant has no mind of its own, but is instead a manifestation of you will, and will follow your orders to the letter. Invisible servants are of little use in combat. As an action, you may have your invisible servant attempt to grapple someone.

Tier_2.name: Minor Gate
Tier_2.description: With a sound like a rush of wind, you tear open a portal large enough to fit yourself and one other individual of your size. It lasts for only a split second, but you may use it to transport yourself and an adjacent ally to a location anywhere within range, regardless of whether or not you can see your destination. If you are trying to move to a spot you cannot see, your Grand Poohbah may require an Intelligence Check to determine how close you get to your target.

Tier_2.name: Smokescreen
Tier_2.description: As you open your mouth, magical smoke billows out and obscures the world around you. Creatures within the smokescreen are considered to be in darkness.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to magically empower the smoke, creating Magical Darkness which thwarts darkvision.

Tier_2.name: Featherfall
Tier_2.description: With a flourish, you produce a feather and ignite it with your magic. In that moment, you may focus your magic on a creature or object to slow its falling speed to that of a feather.
Tier_2.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to use this spell on up to five additonal objects or creatures.

Tier_2.name: Counter Magic
Tier_2.description: Rebuke an enemy as they cast a spell. Instantly stop tier 1 spells. For higher level spells, the caster must make a spell power save or have their magic thwarted. This spell does not affect natural abilities such as a dragon's fire breath.
Tier_2.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, increases the tier of spell instantly countered by one.

Tier_2.name: Song of Mass Healing
Tier_2.description: Your voice swells with divine resonance. At the sound, your allies' wounds begin to knit themselves shut.
Tier_2.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, heal your allies for an additional dice of damage or increase the radius by 30 feet

Tier_2.name: Kilgore's Thunderous Shout
Tier_2.description: Sucking in a breath, you channel the fearsome energy of Kilgore, barbarian minstrel of the realm of cheese and mead. The shout that you release is mighty, and wounds all enemies in a cone before you.
Tier_2.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, enemies suffer an additional 1d6 damage and are pushed back 15 feet further.

effect.description: Anyone struck by the shout must make a spell power save or take damage, be thrown back 15 feet, and be knocked prone. On success, enemies take half damage.

Tier_2.name: Conjure Carriage
Tier_2.description: Raise your hand to hail a magical carriage capable of seating four individuals with additional seats for two drivers. The carriage comes with two magical steeds, which may not be detached, and with an optional ethereal driver.

Tier_2.name: Polymorph
Tier_2.description: Your target's body begins to warp as they seamlessly transition into the form of a non-villain creature of their tier or lower.
Tier_2.upcast: Spend one additional action point on the spell to increase its save to once per week.

effect.description: Unwilling targets may attempt a spell power save to avoid being Transformed. You are able to end the effects of a casting of Polymorph at any time as an action.
effect.save: The spell's victim may repeat their save once per day.

Tier_2.name: Modify Memory
Tier_2.description: Use your magic to invade a creature's mind.

effect.description: You tell a lie so compelling that your target must make a spell power save or have a memory of your choosing modified. The target tries to rationalize the modified memory within reason, but will realize what happened if provided with adequate proof.

Tier_2.name: Zone of Truth
Tier_2.description: Tracing magical glyphs in the air around you, you perform a ritual to transform an area into a zone of truth. When within the zone, anyone who attempts to tell a lie is immediately struck ill, and vomits.

Tier_2.name: Power Shriek
Tier_2.description: Inhale, exhale, inhale again, then release the most shameful of all magics: a power shriek! A focused tide of air rushes through all enemies in a line before you.
Tier_2.upcast: You can spend an additional action point on this spell to double its range.

effect.description: Anyone struck by the attack must make a spell power save or be Deafened and begin Bleeding.
effect.save: This spell's victims may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

Tier_2.name: Corvo's Contagious Waltz
Tier_2.description: As you wave a baton, a ghostly chorus is taken up and a haunting waltz begins to play.

components: An object ot use as a baton

effect.description: Enemies within the spell's radius must make a spell power save or be Slowed and Distracted.
effect.save: The spell's victims may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns or once every five minutes when out of combat.

Tier_2.name: Unstoppable
Tier_2.description: Slap an object or person to make them unstoppable for 6 seconds. The object must be the size of a wagon or smaller. Items struck by an unstoppable object are pushed if they are not fixed in place. If an unstopable object meets an immovable object they both instantly vanish and are teleported to the realm of chaos along with anyone touching them.

Tier_2.name: Lullaby
Tier_2.description: Humming to yourself, you begin a gentle lullaby, lulling your targets into a state of gentle repose. Each turn, this spell costs an action.

effect.description: So long as they can hear, anyone you choose within the spell's radius must make a spell power save at the start of each turn. On the first failure, they becomes dreary and are Hindered. On a second failure, they fall into a deep slumber, and are Incapacitated.
effect.save: The spell's victims remain asleep until damaged or awoken by a successful save. Saves are repeated once every ten minutes.

Tier_2.name: Tamberdoodle's Grasp
Tier_2.description: Gripping one of your arms at the wrist, you conjure a massive hand made of magical energy. The hand is Large in size, and appears in an unoccupied space of your choosing. You are able to command the hand as though it is an extension of your body, though it must remain within the spell's radius. The hand remains until it falls to zero health or you lose concentration on it.

Tier_2.name: Hava's Tricksy Escape
Tier_2.description: Close your eyes and repeat three times the words 'Whisked away, vanished' and then 'Poof!' As you finish, you disappear and in that moment a perfect illusion of you appears in your place. The illusion is an echo of your soul and moves and acts perfectly as you would have for the spell's duration. When the spell ends, your duplicate disappears and you recieve all of their memories.
Tier_2.upcast: You can spend an additional action point on this spell to make it last for ten minutes.

effect.description: While the spell is active, you are Invisible.

Tier_3.name: Winged Magic Steed
Tier_3.description: Raise your fingers to your mouth and whistle. Instantly, a winged steed appears, made of pure magical energy. The stallion may be de-summoned on command. If you have access to Conjure Carriage, it may be used in conjunction with this spell at no cost.

Tier_3.name: Edmire's Grand Manor
Tier_3.description: When you learn this spell, a key appears in your hand. Any time that you wish, you may cast this spell to cause a door to appear, which may be unlocked with the key. Within, you find a massive mansion capable of housing up to 80 people comfortably in up to 20 bedrooms. The mansion is fully stocked with extravagant food and drink. It is manned by 100 servants, which are at the beck and call of the mansion's creator. You may design the mansion to have rooms that suit the needs of your party, for example a holy sanctum, dungeons, training grounds and a kitchen. At will, you may give additional keys to trusted individuals. As soon as they have a key, they learn this spell, and may also summon the door. Nothing that originated within the mansion may be taken out. However, items brought in may stay. Once a door to the mansion is used, it lingers for ten minutes. During that time, anyone that finds it may attempt to break in.

Tier_3.name: Marionette
Tier_3.description: You hoist your hand as they you are controlling a puppet and focus on an enemy.

effect.description: Your target must make a spell power save or be Controlled.
effect.save: The spell's victim may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns and once every hour.

Tier_3.name: Strike Dumb
Tier_3.description: Utter a phrase so mind-bendingly intricate that anyone who hears it becomes confused.

effect.description: Your spell's target must make a spell power save. On success, they are Distracted. On failure, they are Dumbstruck.
effect.save: The spell's victim may repeat their save once per month.

Tier_3.name: Nothing but Unicorns
Tier_3.description: Glitter dances in the air as rainbows erupt from your mouth and fingertips, streaming in three lines towards your foes. As they streak forth, each the colors tangle and combine into the form of a stampede of unicorns!

effect.description: Enemies struck by the stampede must make a spell power save or have their perception of reality distorted. To them, you appear to take the form of a giant, jet black unicorn with blazing red eyes and a bloody horn. Meanwhile, the rest of the world begins to shimmer as sparkles emanate from objects randomly, and the ground begins to undulate. They are Frightened of you and are Distracted and Hindered.
effect.save: The spell's victims may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

Tier_3.name: Summon Bleck
Tier_3.description: Summon a mighty bleck to fight for you! A bleck is a gooey, little creature with a one inch diameter. Bleck have 1 hit point, and are incapable of attacking. They move at a rate of one foot per minute. Bleck cannot be damaged by crushing force or blades, as they will merely be split and then reform. After five seconds, a bleck splits into two blecks. Each of these blecks wait for five seconds, and then split into two more. The weight of a million bleck is enough to kill a bleck. Bleck that are killed remain for 1 minute before dissolving into nothingness. After the spell's duration, all bleck are destroyed.

components: A piece of coal blessed by a high priest of Juliet (100gp)

Tier_3.name: I Know Malkizar!
Tier_3.description: Gather your strength and perform an ancient ritual of obfuscation. Alter the mind of everyone who viewed an event and them that there was another person present named Malkizar. In fourteen words or fewer, describe what Malkizar did. Everyone who witnessed the event now earnestly believes that Malkizar was present and performed the action you described.

name: Knight

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Bulwark against evil. Knights stand tall on the front-line of an adventuring party. All but unkillable, it is their duty to protect their less resilient companions, standing in the way of blows that would slay wizards and rogues where they stand. While many knights work for coin or glory, others are called by a higher purpose. Such paladins can learn divine magic and use it to heal their allies and burn their foes with radiant light. Whether serving as bastion or healer, knights are a shield, holding their party together and standing strong against any foe.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Knights are strong of body and spirit. Whether bending the bars of a prison cell, charging through a locked door, or putting enemies in their place, a knight's superior strength is of great use to their adventuring party. When things look grim, a party's knight can be counted on to keep going, no matter what. Vile curses, hazardous weather, and incredible fatigue can do little to cause a knight to flag.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Many knights have a special affinity for speaking with other men-at-arms, using the bond of battle to forge fast friendships. Gleaming plate can be intimidating to the peasantry, though it tends to inspire awe rather than fear.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: A knight can be counted on to stand at the front line, using their abilities to focus the attention of enemies and stop them from attacking a party's ranged combatants and mages. If a knight invests in their Paladin tree, they gain the ability to bolster their allies' defenses and can become a viable party healer. Regardless of the path that you take, your role as a knight will be to defend your party and to punish any enemy that would try to harm them.

expertise: As a knight, you have expertise in raw feats of strength such as breaking the iron bars of a cell, bursting through a locked door, or rolling a heavy boulder. You also take expertise in charisma when speaking with men-at-arms and law-abiding common folk.

abilities.name: Faithful Weapon
abilities.description: Pray over a weapon for an hour to impart it with the intention of your diety. From then on, the weapon deals bonus damage. While you are within the ability's radius, you may summon your bound weapon to your hand. It will fly towards you in as straight a line as it can manage. If an enemy is struck by the weapon as it returns to you, you may treat it as an attack with your inner fire as its modifier. You may summon your weapon as an offhand action or as your reaction. You may bind yourself to at most one weapon in this way at a time.

abilities.name: Charge
abilities.description: With a mighty cry, you barrel into the fray. Rush ahead a distance equal to your dash of 25ft, whichever is higher. For the length, you are immune to exposed attacks and deal damage to any enemy whose space you move through.

effect.description: Enemies struck by your passing must make a spell power save or be knocked Prone.

abilities.name: Healing Blow
abilities.description: Your weapon radiates light as you slam it into your foe. Deal bonus damage to an enemy. All allies within the ability's radius immediately restore an amount of health equal to the bonus damage dealt.

abilities.name: Healing Hands
abilities.description: Golden light shines in your hand as you reach out to an injured ally, staving off the worst of their injury.

abilities.name: Last Hope
abilities.description: You are steadfast in the face of despair. Whenever an ally has fallen in a combat or is on death's door, add a bonus to any healing you perform.

abilities.name: Guardian Ward
abilities.description: As you focus on an ally, a blazing sigil burns above their head.

effect.description: While they remain within the ability's radius, they are considered Guarded. At most one ally may have a guardian ward at a time. Guardian wards disappear if their bearer falls unconcious.

abilities.name: Holy Shield
abilities.description: As you raise your hand, a shield of golden light shimmers around a chosen ally. They are granted temporary hit points for the spell's duration.

abilities.name: Ward Conversion
abilities.description: As danger closes in about your allies, use your power to convert any Guardian Wards you've deployed into Holy Shields."

abilities.name: Aura of Hope
abilities.description: You have grown strong enough that you exude a powerful aura of holy energy. This bolstering effect protects your allies from despair and hardens them against the abilities of your foes.
abilities.upcast: You can spend one action point to increase this ability's radius to 30ft for one hour.

effect.description: If an ally stands within the effect's radius, they may add +2 to all saving throws and make death coin flips at advantage.

abilities.name: Link Lifeforce
abilities.description: A sparkling weave of light binds you to an ally who bears a Guardian Ward before fading into invisibility.

effect.description: For the ability's duration, your life force is magically bound to that of one or more allies with a guardian ward. Until you use a free action to unlink yourself on your turn, you may take all or a portion of their damage.

abilities.name: Enhanced Healing
abilities.description: When you heal an ally with a guardian ward, they restore additional health.

abilities.name: Second Guardian Ward
abilities.description: Your divine power is growing. You have gained the ability to maintian two guardian wards at a time.

abilities.name: Shield Of Men
abilities.description: Burst forward to save someone from harm. As a reaction, jump in front of an ally to become the target of a physical attack aimed at them. Any damage you recieve as a result of this ability is halved.

abilities.name: Steel Yourself
abilities.description: Prepare for an attack as it hurtles towards you, hardening yourself against its damanage. As a Free Action, halve the damage of an attack made against you. You may declare this after seeing its outcome.

abilities.name: Stay on Your Feet
abilities.description: Even battered and bloodied, you fight on. If you fall to zero health, make a D10 inner fire saving throw. If you succeed, drop to 1 health instead.

abilities.name: None Shall Pass
abilities.description: You are a bulwark of steel, hindering any enemy advance.

effect.description: When you make your exposed attack, your enemy must make a spell power save or be Halted. Even if they succeed, they are Hindered.

abilities.name: Controlled Advance
abilities.description: As a foe falls to your blade, use the oportunity to push into their ranks. Whenever you slay an enemy with a melee attack, you may step forward into the space that they occupied. You are immune to exposed attacks during this movement. Once you've moved, you may either attack again or Ready your Stance.

abilities.name: Sentinel's Reaction
abilities.description: You have developed a supernatural ability to read the battlefield and to be where you are needed.

effect.description: Each turn, you are able to take a second reaction.

abilities.name: Pivot
abilities.description: As foes circle, place yourself between them and a nearby ally. Trade spaces with a willing creature within the ability's radius.

abilities.name: Phalanx
abilities.description: Adopt a defensive stance, granting all allies within five feet your protection.

effect.description: While they stand at your side, your allies are considered to be Guarded.

abilities.name: Overwhelming Strike
abilities.description: With a blow like a hammerfall, you batter your enemy a devestating attack.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save, or be Stunned until the end of their next turn.

abilities.name: Slowing Strike
abilities.description: Slice at your enemy's legs in an attempt to hinder their movement.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save  or be Slowed until the end of their next turn.

abilities.name: Last Line Of Defense
abilities.description: Rage fills you as your allies begin to fall.

effect.description: Add bonus damage to your attacks if an ally has fallen in this combat or is on death's door.

abilities.name: Goad
abilities.description: Call a challenge to an enemy.

effect.description: Your target must make a spell power save or become Fixated on you.
effect.save: They may repeat their saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Inspiring Critical
abilities.description: The sight of you landing an incredible blow fills one of your allies with determination.

effect.description: Whenever you spend a hero token, additionally grant a chosen ally a 1d6 inspiration dice. This ability works in conjunction with other critical abilities.

abilities.name: Shield Bash
abilities.description: Smash into an enemy with your offhand as you attempt to knock them off balance.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or become Vulnerable to the next attack made against them.

abilities.name: Lionhearted
abilities.description: Your presence soothes your allies, inspiring them and guarding them against fear.

effect.description: Inspire all allies within the ability's radius. Furthermore, for the ability's duration, any friendly creaturess who are within 30ft of you are immune to the Frightened condition.

abilities.name: Very Dangerous over Short Distances
abilities.description: Once you've closed with an enemy, you are able to deal massive damage.

effect.description: If you begin your turn next to a creature, deal an extra 1d6 damage on any attacks that you make against them.

name: Barbarian

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: All muscle and rage, the Barbarian is a powerful frontline fighter. With their exceptional health and resileince, the Barbarian is able to shrug off blows that would level their allies. Once a Barbarian closes with an enemy they deal massive damage, laying low anyone that dares stand in their way. Out of combat, the Barbarian is among the strongest of the races, and they use that strength to overcome their problems. The Barbarian's main weakness is their lack of arcane knowledge; for this reason, they are best backed up by a Bard, Cleric, or other support mage.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: The Barbarians great strength can be vital while adventuring. Whether they are bursting through walls or heaving great boulders, members of the Barbarian's party will stand on in awe as they use their strength to perform feats that look like magic.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: While many Barbarians are at home among ruffians and thieves, others are gentle giants. Regardless, any Barbarian is able to use their demeanor to intimidate if necessary. When questioning someone, the party may deploy their Barbarian to learn the truth.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Because of their strength and resilience, a party's Barbarian is usually found on the front line of combat. They are expert at both offense and defense. As a Barbarian grows in strength, their abilities layer atop one another, until even a normal attack deals massive damage. Barbarians are weak against magical attacks, however, and need a solid back line to support them.

expertise: As a barbarian, you have expertise in raw feats of strength such as breaking the iron bars of a cell, bursting through a locked door, or rolling a heavy boulder. Barbarians also take expertise in intimidation.

abilities.name: Berserk
abilities.description: Rage fills you until it threatens to overflow and consume you. For the ability's duration, deal bonus damage on every blow you strike.

effect.description: Further, take resistance to physical damage. When berserk ends, take a level of exhaustion.

abilities.name: Relentless Rage
abilities.description: Blood thunders in your ears as you rage, blocking out attacks against your mind.

effect.description: When you are going berserk, you are resistant to psychic damage and immune to conditions of the mind.

abilities.name: Blood for Blood
abilities.description: When you are going berserk and an enemy harms you, you may use your reaction to make a counterattack.

abilities.name: Adrenaline
abilities.description: A bloody grin spreads across your face as you hurtle towards your foes.

effect.description: When you go berserk, you are Quickened.

abilities.name: Throw Anything
abilities.description: Sometimes, you can't get close enough to punch. That makes you angry, so you've developed a technique to fix the problem: throw things! Add 1d6 damage to any thrown weapon attacks that you make. If a weapon has the thrown property, you may throw it twice as far. If it does not, you may throw it up to 30 feet.

abilities.name: Taunt
abilities.description: A glint in your eye and a bloody smile on your face, you scream a challenge to the world around you!

effect.description: All enemies in the ability's radius must make a spell power saving throw or become Fixated on you.
effect.save: They may reattempt their save at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Single Out
abilities.description: Survey the battlefield and pick out an enemy that you hate in particular.

effect.description: You gain 15ft of movement on any turn when you move towards them and they are considered Vulnerable to your attacks.

abilities.name: Terrify
abilities.description: As the enemy you've singled out looks up at your dark, rage-filled eyes, their constitution shakes.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or become Frightened of you.
effect.save: They may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns, or once every five minutes when out of combat.

abilities.name: Stay on Your Feet
abilities.description: Even battered and bloodied, you fight on. If you fall to zero health, make a D10 inner fire saving throw. If you succeed, drop to 1 health instead.

abilities.name: Blaze of Glory
abilities.description: As you take injuries, your resolve only strengthens. If you fall below one quarter health all damage you take is halved.

abilities.name: Meat Shield
abilities.description: When you see an incoming attack, you may attempt to shield yourself with an adjacent enemy.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or be pulled into the attack's way. If they die and you have the Throw Anything ability, you may immediately make an attack using them as a thrown weapon.

abilities.name: Brutal Attack
abilities.description: Your muscles buldge and the earth shakes as you lash out at your enemy with a particularly vicious attack.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw or be knocked Prone.

abilities.name: Frightening Blow
abilities.description: Spittle flies from your mouth and your eyes roll back as you strike at a foe.

effect.description: A dark aura surrounds you, and everyone within 30ft of your target must make a spell power save or become Frightened of you.

abilities.name: The Opener
abilities.description: If you move quickly at the start of combat, you're able to get the drop on your foes. If you attack an enemy that has not yet taken a turn, use Brutal Attack at no cost.

abilities.name: Throw Caution to the Wind
abilities.description: Surge forward with reckless abandon, dealing bonus damage but leaving yourself exposed.

effect.description: At any time, you may declare that your attacks deal extra damage. However, when you make such an attack, you become Vulnerable until the start of your next turn.

abilities.name: Guard-Break
abilities.description: Swing high and fast in an effort to batter away your opponent's defenses.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or become Vulnerable.
effect.save: They may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Rending Strike
abilities.description: With a hiss of air, you slash your opponent with your weapon.

effect.description: As your attack tears your enemy asunder, they must make a spell power saving throw or treat this ability's bonus damage as Bleeding.

abilities.name: The Closer
abilities.description: You use every opening to prove your glory. If you attack an enemy that is prone, deal bonus damage.

abilities.name: Terrifying Damage
abilities.description: You've learned to use your enemies' terror to your advantage. When you attack an enemy that is Frightened of you, deal bonus damage.

abilities.name: Chain Attack
abilities.description: As your foes' bodies fall around you, a fiendish energy courses through your veins.

effect.description: Whenever you slay an enemy, you are Spurred to Action.

abilities.name: Savage Critical
abilities.description: As you lay an enemy low, an aura of wild brutality swirls about you.

effect.description: Whenever you use a hero token, all enemies the ability's radius must make a spell power save or be Frightened until the end of your next turn.

abilities.name: Corner
abilities.description: They won't get away that easy! If an enemy moves to pass you within 15 feet to either side, you may spend a reaction to block them.

effect.description: If they are one size larger than you or smaller, they are immediately Halted unless they are flying. Otherwise, they may make a spell power save.

abilities.name: Every Wall is a Door
abilities.description: Use your strength to blast through an obstacle that is two feet thick or less, to climb solid stone, or to leap a trecherous gap. Move up to your base speed unimpeded. You are still vulnerable to exposed attacks.

abilities.name: I cast 'Fist'
abilities.description: Don your pointy hat and grab your stick, you've become a wizard! Your physical movements are so powerful that they warp the world around you. You are able to cast the equivalent of simple magic as long as you can explain how the shear power of your movements are causing the effects to occur. Follow the rules for informal magic, but always spend an action point.

abilities.name: A Little Terror
abilities.description: Use your intimidating presense to force an enemy to do your will.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw or either be Controlled for one turn or answer three of your questions truthfully.

name: Fighter

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: A master of combat, the fighter is a force to be reckoned with. Some are tactical masterminds, improving their allies' resolve and granting them powerful bonuses in combat. Others rush in, using their superior evasion and combat prowess to overwhelm their enemies. Outside combat, fighters are versatile members of an adventuring party, using their athletic abilities to overcome all manner of obstacles.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Whether cool and calculated or brash and forthright, fighters are often front and center in any challenge. Because they are hearty and self-sufficient, a fighter doesn't mind taking a few blows to protect their party.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: It is not out of the ordinary for a fighter to be the face of the party, especially when dealing with other combat-minded individuals. Fighters may use their combat prowess to intimidate others when necessary. However, it is the fighter's personality rather than their class that defines how they behave in social settings.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Many fighters charge into the fray, weapon and shield in hand. Others hang back, using ranged weapons to pick off their foes. Fighters can specialize in damage, evasion, or command, though many will choose a balance between the three, making them to be versatile and deadly opponents.

expertise: As a fighter, you gain expertise in athletics. Athletics includes leaping, swimming, climbing a rope, and other such checks. It does not include feats of raw strength or dexterity such as lifting a heavy box, cartwheeling, or dancing.

abilities.name: Backpedal
abilities.description: As an attack skates off your armor, use the opportunity to reposition yourself. Whenever you are attacked, move 5ft without provoking exposed attacks as a free action.

abilities.name: Counter
abilities.description: As battle rages, you find an opening in your enemies' mistakes. When an enemy attacks you, you may use your reaction to counter with a standard attack.

abilities.name: Feint
abilities.description: Take up a defensive position as enemies circle. The next enemy who attacks you does so at disadvantage. You may immediately make a standard attack as a free action. Feint does not stack with Counter.

abilities.name: Self-Sufficient
abilities.description: Gritting your teeth, you quickly field dress your wounds. No time for dying, you've got to get back in there!

abilities.name: Command
abilities.description: You survey the battlefield with a trained eye and spot an opportunity. Quickly, you shout an order to one of your allies.

effect.description: Your target is Spurred to Action.

abilities.name: Lead the Way
abilities.description: You spring into action before others can think. Whenever you roll initiative for combat, add your expertise to the result.

abilities.name: Move!
abilities.description: Through years of experience, you are able to read a battlefield in moments and to see where your party's formation is failing.

effect.description: You can call out a quick order to your allies to Spur them to Movement and allow them to reposition themselves.

abilities.name: Prepare for Combat
abilities.description: As combat begins, you are able to quickly give orders to the allies around you.

effect.description: Everyone within the ability's radius is Spurred to Movement before the fighting starts. This ability does not go into effect if you are surprised by combat.

abilities.name: Critical Onslaught
abilities.description: Quickly follow up when you score a heavy blow.

effect.description: You may spend a hero token to make an extra action in combat.

abilities.name: Resurgence
abilities.description: Take heart as your foes fall before you. Whenever you slay an enemy, regain one action point. You can benefit from this ability at most once per turn. The enemy that you slay must pose a threat to you or your party as determined by the Grand Poohbah.

abilities.name: Reduced Critical
abilities.description: You now gain a hero token when you roll a 19 or 20.

abilities.name: Determination
abilities.description: As battle rages about you, take a moment to find your inner focus.

effect.description: For the ability's duration, add your expertise to all checks.

abilities.name: Final Blow
abilities.description: When you fall to zero health, you may make one last, desperate attack. If the attack fells the enemy that struck you, remain standing at one hit point.

abilities.name: Dashing Strike
abilities.description: You sprint towards your enemey, weapon aloft and ready to strike. .

abilities.name: Follow Up
abilities.description: Blow after blow, you wear your target down. If you attack an enemy, subsequent attacks deal extra damage if you don't choose another target. Extra damage starts at 1d4 and grows with each hit, capping at 1d12.

abilities.name: Make Space
abilities.description: You slam into your enemy with oppressive force.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw. On failure, they are thrown back 15 feet. If they strike something as a result, they are Staggered until the end of their next turn. When Make Space is triggered, you may choose to follow after the enemy without provoking exposed attacks.

abilities.name: Goading Attack
abilities.description: A bloody grin fixed upon your face, you make an attack meant to get your enemy's attention.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or become Fixated on you.
effect.save: They may repeat their saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Guard-Break
abilities.description: Swing high and fast in an effort to batter away your opponent's defenses.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or become Vulnerable.
effect.save: They may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Lunge
abilities.description: You are able to extend your reach to make lunging attacks. You can make melee attacks at a 5ft extended range at disadvantage.

abilities.name: Cleave
abilities.description: Swing your weapon in a wide arc, targetting all enemies within 5ft. of you.

abilities.name: Precision Strike
abilities.description: With a hiss of air, you effortlessly slice through your enemy.

effect.description: Your target must make a spell power saving throw or the damage dealt by this attack is considered Bleeding.

abilities.name: Hindering Blow
abilities.description: You aim a carefully placed attack against your target to slow their advance.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw or be Hindered.

abilities.name: Rally Cry
abilities.description: Holding your weapon aloft, you shout encouragement to your party.

effect.description: All allies within the ability's radius are Inspired.

abilities.name: Allied Strike
abilities.description: As you strike your opponent, you batter away their defenses and deal bonus damage.

effect.description: If an ally attacks that opponent before the start of your next turn, they also deal bonus damage per this ability.

abilities.name: Weapon Master
abilities.description: You are highly proficient with all weapons. Increase the dice size of any weapon you wield by one step. If it is a d12 weapon, instead add 1d4. Further, pick one of the following effect:

options.name: Ranged Weapon Master
options.description: When using ranged weapons, enemies moving within 30ft of you are considered Exposed.

options.name: Shield Master
options.description: Gain an additional +2 armor when carrying a shield.

options.name: Martial Weapon Master
options.description: Any attack you make with a martial weapon deals an additional 1d6 damage.

name: Monk

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Faithful servants of an order, Monks have been trained in martial combat to protect its teachings. Some such orders are religious, while others, like the Ordo Liborum, serve a concept like the protection of knowledge. Monks are powerful hand-to-hand fighters, and are among the most agile of the classes. They are especially adept at taking a single enemy out of the equation. A Monk often holds valuable answers about the world at large, and is able to help their party navigate complex situations.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Among the most dexterous of the classes, Monks have unique freedom of movement. Whether they are climbing sheer walls or leaping across rooftops, a party's monk can often gain access to locations that others cannot. This is useful for everything from performing reconniasance to tying a rope to a hard to reach place. A Monk's training and connection to the spiritual also means that they often have insight into ancient ruins, strange symbols, and other traces of ancient lore.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Monks are a peculiar breed of creature. Depending on their order, they may be stoic, boisterous, or even constantly sleepy. The lifestyle of a Monk is not for everyone, and most pick up a few quirks along the way. Monks have a deep sense of loyalty and purpose, and it is not rare to find a monk with a mission given to them by their order. The way that a given Monk will behave in social interactions is deeply linked to the stances of their order, and their relationship to them.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Monks excel at one-on-one combat, and are quickly able to overpower single foes. Only rogues rival monks in mobility; monks are able to free-run across the battlefeild, leaping from ledge to wall before scoring a plunging attack on their foe. If a monk finds themselves surrounded, they can assume a Dodging Stance and counter missed attacks. Perhaps the monks greatest ability, however, is their ability to block a mage's Chi and stop them from casting.

expertise: As a monk, you gain proficiency in acrobatics. This includes cartwheeling, parkour, and climbing. You also take proficiency in insight, which includes gleaning information about someone's motives or thoughts, and in history checks.

abilities.name: Hand to Hand Expert
abilities.description: You don't need weapons to be deadly.

effect.description: Whenever you make an unarmed attack, increase the damage dice by one step. For the sake of abilities, simple blunt weapons including quarterstaffs are considered unarmed weapons. Further, you may use either strength or dexterity as the damage modifier for unarmed attacks.

abilities.name: Unarmored Defense
abilities.description: Through constant training, you have hardened your body to physical damage.

effect.description: You are considered to be resistant to physical damage.

abilities.name: Slowing Blow
abilities.description: In a flurry of quick blows, you strike at your opponent's pressure points and sap their energy.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or be Slowed until the end of their next turn.

abilities.name: Make Space
abilities.description: You slam into your enemy with oppressive force.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw. On failure, they are thrown back 15 feet. If they strike something as a result, they are Staggered until the end of their next turn. When Make Space is triggered, you may choose to follow after the enemy without provoking exposed attacks.

abilities.name: Disarming Strike
abilities.description: With deft precision, you make a targetted strike meant to free an object from an enemy's grasp.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw. On failure, they are Disarmed.

abilities.name: Critical Onslaught
abilities.description: You are able to quickly follow up when you land a heavy blow.

effect.description: You can spend a hero token to take an additional action in combat.

abilities.name: Flow with the Battle
abilities.description: You are a master of pivoting around your foes,

effect.description: and are able to pass through an enemy's space in combat.

abilities.name: Flurry of Blows
abilities.description: In rapid succession, make unarmed attacks against all enemies adjacent to you.

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.description: Your mastery over your body extends to your movement.

effect.description: You are permanently considered to be Quickened.

abilities.name: Freedom of Movement
abilities.description: You've gained such mastery over your physical movement that it appears to be magic. You are able to quickly break free of restraints, to run across water, and to free-run up even the most difficult to traverse surfaces. For most feats of movement, you are able to simply accomplish them. When you attempt something more significant, follow the rules for simple magic, so long as you can explain how you are able to manipulate your body to accomplish a feat. In cases when a check is required, you must spend an action point. Additionally, you are immune to difficult terrain.

abilities.name: Disengage
abilities.description: You dodge and weave between your foes, focusing your energy on avoiding combat.

effect.description: For the remainder of your turn, you are Elusive.

abilities.name: Reduced Critical
abilities.description: You now gain a heroic token when you roll a 19 or 20.

abilities.name: Dodging Stance
abilities.description: Spend a moment to enter a defensive stance.

effect.description: Until the end of your next turn, you are Dodging.

abilities.name: Defensive Dodge
abilities.description: When an attack misses you as a result of your Dodging Stance, you may immediately make an unarmed attack as a free action.

abilities.name: Reflexes
abilities.description: As a reaction, attempt to block a targeted, solid projectile. Roll 1d6 and add your dexterity and expertise, then reduce the damage by that amount. If the damage is reduced to zero, you catch the projectile, and can immediately make a counterattack with it. Increase to 2d6 then 4d6 in gameplay tiers 2 and 3.

abilities.name: Chi Block
abilities.description: With a quick jab of your fist, you strike at the flow of chi within your target.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw. On a failure, they are Blocked.
effect.save: Affected enemies may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

abilities.name: Spiritual Projection
abilities.description: Channel your chi to project an astral version of yourself at a point within the ability's range. The projection lasts for your turn, and may make actions as your proxy. Any damage taken by the astral entity is transferred to you.

abilities.name: Phase Walk
abilities.description: You are tethered to your astral form. If your Spiritual Projection harms an enemy, you may instantly change places with it.

abilities.name: Spiritual Aid
abilities.description: Summon a spiritual version of yourself to stand beside you. When you close your eyes, you may take control of the projection. The projection is Ethereal, and remains for the duration of the ability or until you choose to make a single hand to hand attack through it.

effect.description: The projection

abilities.name: Stunning Critical
abilities.description: As you land a heavy strike against your enemy, knock them off their guard.

effect.description: When you use a hero token to do extra damage, your enemy must make a spell power save or be Stunned.

abilities.name: Chain Strike
abilities.description: When you make an attack with a spiritual projection and hit, you may spend another action point to immediately create another spiritual projection within range of the first and attack with it.

abilities.name: Resting Meditation
abilities.description: Given a moment to rest, you are able to quickly enter a state of deep meditation. As you focus, you command your wounds to heal.

abilities.name: Find Center
abilities.description: Take a moment to center yourself in the world around you. For the remainder of the turn, add your expertise to all checks.

abilities.name: High Ground
abilities.description: Using your superior mobility, you are able to strike you foes from unexpected directions.

effect.description: Whenever you use free-running or a plunging attack to strike an enemy, deal bonus damage.

abilities.name: Resurgence
abilities.description: Take heart as your foes fall before you. Whenever you slay an enemy, regain one action point. You can benefit from this ability at most once per turn. The enemy that you slay must pose a threat to you or your party as determined by the Grand Poohbah.

name: Rogue

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Knives in the dark, rogues are famously stealthy and perceptive. They blend into a crowd like shadow, gathering information or relieving a mark of their life or possessions. Rogues have little health, and as such, it can be disastrous if they are struck by an enemy attack. Thankfully, their stealth and abilities make them among the most slippery of combatants. While others tackle their challenges head on, rogues wait to find openings—when life gives you a guarded door, a rogue is the first to go in through a window.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Incredibly dexterous, rogues are skilled at mantling buildings, lurking in the shadows, disarming traps and picking locks. As a rogue, you will often go in first to make certain the way is safe, using your abilities to clear a path for the less-nimble members of your adventuring party.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: While some rogues stand back silently, others are charming and deceptive. With their nimble fingers, rogues are skilled at pocketing items that aren't theirs, though the wise rogue won't target their party with such exploits.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: Rogues have low health but deal heavy damage to their foes. In combat, they spend much of their time skirting the edges of the fray, looking for opportunities to dash in, land a critical blow, and then disappear into the shadows. Rogues are adept at fighting with daggers, hurling them at opponents and slashing multiple times to deal quick, repeated damage. If a rogue invests in magic, they can use their abilities to avoid damage by becoming invisible, fill an area with shadows, or even launch themselves high into the air.

expertise: As a rogue, you have expertise in all dexterity checks and saves. This includes checks made to climb, sneak, hide, pickpocket, pick locks.

abilities.name: Leap
abilities.description: As you speak the magic word for 'Ascent' you suddenly launch thirty feet into the air. By angling your body, you are able to turn this into an arc.

abilities.name: Summon Darkness
abilities.description: Fill an area with billowing darkness. The darkness is considered magical, and is not affected by darkvision.

effect.description: Anyone in the darkness is considered Blinded unless they have Blindsight, Truesight, or another equivalent ability.

abilities.name: Assisted Strike
abilities.description: Use every opportunity to your advantage as you strike at an enemy.

effect.description: If you have advantage on an attack, you may instead add 1d6 damage to it.

abilities.name: Controlled Descent
abilities.description: The moment before you strike the earth, release a burst of magic to slow yourself.

effect.description: Reduce any falling damage to zero.

abilities.name: Disengage
abilities.description: You dodge and weave between your foes, focusing your energy on avoiding combat.

effect.description: For the remainder of your turn, you are Elusive.

abilities.name: Dodge
abilities.description: Attempt to pivot out of the way of an incoming attack.

effect.description: As a reactive Free Action, declare that you are Dodging.

abilities.name: Evasion
abilities.description: Use your uncanny knack for survival to avoid an explosion or other area of effect attack.

effect.description: When an area of effect attack calls for you to make a spell power saving throw or take half damage, you instead take half damage on a failure, or no damage on a success.

abilities.name: Precision Strike
abilities.description: With a hiss of air, your blade effortlessly slices through an enemy.

effect.description: Your target must make a spell power save or the damage dealt by this attack is considered Bleeding.

abilities.name: Flank
abilities.description: When your allies are near an enemy, you are able to avoid that foe's sight.

effect.description: If a creature is Harried, you are considered to be hiding when attacking from behind them. If you begin a turn flanking an enemy, you may break from them without provoking exposed attacks.

abilities.name: Flow with the Battle
abilities.description: You are a master of pivoting around your foes,

effect.description: and are able to pass through an enemy's space in combat.

abilities.name: Chain Attack
abilities.description: As your enemies' bodies fall around you, a fiendish energy courses through your veins.

effect.description: Whenever you slay an enemy, you are Spurred to Action.

abilities.name: Thief's Mark
abilities.description: As you lay a hand on a creature, a small brand glows on their skin.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you always know in which direction the creature lies. Attacks that you make against the creature deal 1d6 additional damage.

abilities.name: Radiant Invisibility Break
abilities.description: When your Spell of Invisibility ends, you may optionally create a flash of blinding light.

effect.description: Beams of radiance wash over everyone nearby, and anyone within the ability's radius must make a spell power save or be Blinded until the end of their next turn or for ten seconds while out of combat.

abilities.name: Reduced Critical
abilities.description: You now gain a hero token when you roll a 19 or 20.

abilities.name: Ride The Blindspot
abilities.description: You have learned to stay behind a flanked enemy, even if they try to turn on you.

effect.description: If an enemy you have flanked tries to look at you, you may spend an action point to pivot around them as a reaction. If they try to move, you may move with them. Ride the Blindspot continues until the end of the enemy's turn.

abilities.name: Shared Stealth
abilities.description: Your stealth is so great that you are able to make up for your parties' shortcomings.

effect.description: For the next hour, add your proficiency to any friendly stealth rolls made within the ability's radius. If a party member already benefits from proficiency on stealth rolls, they may instead add an additional +1.

abilities.name: Slip Away
abilities.description: You are able to streak in, harm a foe, and then retreat again.

effect.description: Whenever you strike an enemy, you are considered Elusive to them until the end of your turn.

abilities.name: Spell Of Darkvision
abilities.description: Your pupil's expand to cover your eyes, leaving them pools of inky darkness. If light strikes them at the right angle, they glow like those of a beast in the night.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you benefit from Darkvision.

abilities.name: Spell Of Distraction
abilities.description: Call upon your magic to create a minor ruckus, illusion, or voice at a position you can see within range.

effect.description: When in combat, entities the spell's radius must make a spell sower save or become Distracted until the end of their next turn.

abilities.name: Spell Of Invisibility
abilities.description: With a muttered breath, you touch your magic and you cloak yourself in an ethereal shroud.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you are Invisible to the mortal eye, a wraith among the living.

abilities.name: Strike From The Shadows
abilities.description: Silent as a shadow, you slip behind a foe and take them unawares.

effect.description: Add 1d6 damage to attacks made from hiding.

abilities.name: Thief's Strike
abilities.description: While you stab an enemy with one hand, you attempt to rob them blind with the other.

effect.description: Your target must make a spell power saving throw or you are able to steal one object from them. If your attack is ranged, you may instead declare that an object is knocked free of their grasp. The object must be held by or tethered to them, and you must be able to explain how you manage to steal it in a way that is acceptable to the Grand Poohbah.

abilities.name: Throw Caution to the Wind
abilities.description: Surge forward with reckless abandon, dealing bonus damage but leaving yourself exposed.

effect.description: At any time, you may declare that your attacks deal extra damage. However, when you make such an attack, you become Vulnerable until the start of your next turn.

abilities.name: Unseen Hand
abilities.description: Mutter a spell to will an ethereal hand into existence. While you concentrate on it, the hand acts as an extension of your will. The hand has a flying speed of 25 feet and may not leave the spell's radius. Its strength score is equivalent to your inner fire modifier.

abilities.name: Wasting Blow
abilities.description: As you land a particularly well placed blow, you slice into your opponents vitals and sap their strength.

effect.description: They must make a spell power saving throw or become weakened until the end of their next turn.

name: Druid

handbook.title: Intro
handbook.text: Guardians of nature, druids are forged in lightning, shaped by root and spore, and raised by the creatures of the wilds. Druids can be found in even the most unforgiving climbs. They thrive atop craggy, frozen peaks and deserts of driving sand. They employ powerful natural magics, allowing them to shape both the world and themselves. Fledgling druids can transform themselves into the form of a chosen animal, conjure swarms of bees to distract and harm their foes, and speak to plants and growing things. Unlike wizards, druids learn from each other and from the world around them rather than from dusty tomes. As such, a druid quickly forms a deep communion with nature, and will preserve the natural order, no matter the cost.

handbook.title: When Adventuring
handbook.text: Druidic magic presents nature-based solutions to many problems encountered while adventuring. The ability to transform into birds, beasts, and fish allows druids to go and survive most anywhere.

handbook.title: When Socializing
handbook.text: Many druids have a spirit animal that they hold dear to their heart, and it is not abnormal for them to take on the characteristics of that animal. Lone wolves, patient spiders, cunning foxes, and others can be found among the druids, coloring their social interactions.

handbook.title: When in Combat
handbook.text: In combat, druids are masters of controlling the battlefield with spells that shape the landscape and move their enemies. Druids are also capable of dealing heavy damage and of healing their allies in a pinch, making them well rounded combatants.

expertise: As a druid you gain expertise in all nature based investigation and survival checks, such as checks made to navigate a forest, cave, or dungeon.

Tier_1.name: Elemental Armor
Tier_1.description: With a howl like the wind, your choice of fire, ice, or lightning swaddles you.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you are guarded and are resistant to damage based on the chosen element.

Tier_1.name: Control Plant Growth
Tier_1.description: As you beckon, plants spring from the earth and stretch towards the sky. You can create a plant of up to the size of a tree and may shape its growth for the spell's duration.

Tier_1.name: Crown of Fireflies
Tier_1.description: A ring of glowing fireflies dance around your head, bathing the surrounding area in light The fireflies follow your subconscious commands, but must remain within the spell's radius.

Tier_1.name: Echolocate
Tier_1.description: Your ears itch as they stretch and open themselves to the subtlest of sounds. You are able to emit a barely-audible sonic pulse, which gives you a detailed picture of the world within the spell's radius. For the spell's duration, you can continue to make such perception checks, but are Vulnerable to any auditory damage.

Tier_1.name: Mend
Tier_1.description: Warm light glows faintly from an object's dents, dings, or tears as you mend it. For simple objects, this spell has no cost.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend one action point to magically mend serious damage to an item or structure. For example, mend a broken wagon wheel, repair the blade of a broken sword, or put together the pieces of a torn up map. It is left to the Grand Poohbah to determine the limits of your mending.

Tier_1.name: Frost Bite
Tier_1.description: A latticework of frost spreads across your focus, then wraps around one of your enemies.

effect.description: If you roll a 6 on any of the dice for this attack, the enemy is Hindered until the end of their next turn.

Tier_1.name: Constricting Vine
Tier_1.description: At your beck, snare-like vines writhe from the earth and grasp at your target's feet.

effect.description: Average sized creatures must make a spell power save or be Grappled. Large enemies must make a spell power save or be Hindered on their next turn.

Tier_1.name: Bees!
Tier_1.description: A deep hum fills the air as a swarm of bees pours forth from your focus and into an area of your choosing. Whenever a creature begins their turn within the radius or moves into it, they take damage as the bees sting them. A creature may be harmed at most one time by a swarm of bees per round of combat

effect.description: Whenever a creature takes damage from the bees, they must make a spell power saving throw or become Distracted until they leave the swarm.

Tier_1.name: Elemental Beam
Tier_1.description: Tracing a glyph in the air, you send a helix of fire and ice howling towards your enemies. The beam strikes all enemies in a line up to the spell’s range.

effect.description: Targets must make a spell power save or be either Burning or Slowed.
effect.save: Slowed targets remain so until the end of their next turn.

Tier_1.name: Poison Jet
Tier_1.description: Putrid purple liquid bubbles and hisses as it sprays from your focus, bathing enemies in a cone in front of you.

effect.description: Targets must make a spell power save or be Poisoned.
effect.save: The spell's victims may reattempt their save at the end of each of their turns.

Tier_1.name: Spores
Tier_1.description: Spores of greenish-black billow from you, filling a radius of your choice. These living parasites heed your whim, entering the lungs of your foes while avoiding your friends.
Tier_1.upcast: For each additional action point spent on this spell, increase the radius by 15 feet.

effect.description: Enemies who begins their turn within the spell's radius must make a spell power saving or be Leeched for the spell's unmodified damage. On success, they are not leeched and they take half damage from the spell.

Tier_1.name: Bark Armor
Tier_1.description: Take a seed in your hand and whisper to it, instructing it to protect you or an ally from harm.

effect.description: As it adheres to your target, gnarled bark sprouts from and around their armor, hardening them against attacks and granting them resistance to physical damage for the spell's duration.

Tier_1.name: Voice of Nature
Tier_1.description: Like a drop of sunlight, magic touches your mind and opens your ears so that you can understand the tongues of the birds, beasts, and plants. For the spell's duration, you may speak with natural things and understand them, and you have advantage when attempting to pacify hostile creatures.

Tier_1.name: Homeopathic Remedy
Tier_1.description: Working carefully, you mix your magic with elements you find in the world around you. The result is a natural remedy, which performs a feat of healing on an ally and instantly removes any minor status effects which ail them. This remedy does not remove curses or effects caused by powerful magic unless determined by the Grand Poohbah.

Tier_1.name: Tailwind
Tier_1.description: Closing your eyes, you call upon the air or water to raise a mighty tailwind or current behind you. The gust has the ability to shift your trajectory while falling, guide a ship through otherwise windless seas, or to rocket you through deep water towards the surface. In combat, you may use this wind to force average sized or smaller enemies to move at half speed when approaching you from the front or to give yourself fifteen feet of additional movement.

Tier_1.name: Animal Form
Tier_1.description: Smoothly as though you were donning a garment, your body transforms into that of a non-magical animal that you have encountered before. In combat, transform yourself into any of the creatures with the 'Transformation' feature in the rulebook.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you are affected by the Transformed condition.You may change back at any time as an action.

Tier_1.name: Forest Guardian
Tier_1.description: With a groan and a creaking of wood, a treeling sprouts from the ground to fight for you. Recasting this spell causes any existing treelings to instantly harden into stumps.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point to summon a second treeling.

Tier_1.name: Fool the Senses
Tier_1.description: Conjure a bitter smelling psychotoxin which wafts towards one of your foes and attempts to addle their mind.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to increase its range to 100 feet and give it a thirty foot radius.

effect.description: The target must make a spell power save or become Estranged.
effect.save: The spell's victim may repeat their save at the end of each of their turns or once per day when out of combat.

Tier_1.name: Elemental Weapon
Tier_1.description: Your choice of fire, ice, or lightning wreathes a weapon as you touch it.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, the weapon is Infused with the element of your choosing.

Tier_1.name: Keeper Kerrick's Stars
Tier_1.description: The air around you shimmers as it fills with specks of glowing dust. These motes of light are attracted to enemies, adhering to them. All attacks made against enemies within the spell's radius are at advantage, invisibility is negated, and incorporeal creatures may be attacked.

Tier_1.name: Fairy Ring
Tier_1.description: You kneel on the earth and mutter in the language of the forest. A ring of white flowers grow about you. The flowers are barely larger than a fingernail, and give off a honey-sweet scent. Enemies cannot enter the ring until you leave it. However, they may still attempt to harm you with ranged weapons. Enemies cannot be forced within the ring, but rather strike it like a wall. If a creature is caught between the ring and another solid object, they take 2d6 damage, but the ring creates room for them.

Tier_1.name: Sanctum
Tier_1.description: Use your magic to make your campsite more defensible. Sticks and rocks set themselves up to snap under enemy feet, giving your party advantage on perception checks against encroaching enemies. Nature itself conspires to hide you from view, granting anyone in the camp advantage on stealth checks.

effect.description: If combat occurs within the spell's radius all enemies are Hindered on their first turn.

Tier_1.name: Water Breathing
Tier_1.description: Touch someone's neck to cause gills to form, granting them the ability to breathe underwater.
Tier_1.upcast: You may spend an additional action point on this spell to grant the effect to up to six nearby allies.

Tier_1.name: Bane
Tier_1.description: Wisps of darkness wreath up to four enemies of your choice.

effect.description: They must make a Spell Power Save or be Diminished.
effect.save: The enemy is affected by the condition until your concentration is broken, regardless of distance.

Tier_1.name: Stride
Tier_1.description: The world shifts around you to ease your passing.

effect.description: For the spell's duration, you are Quickened.

Tier_1.name: Somin's Shillelagh
Tier_1.description: As you hold out your hand, a magical shillelagh appears within it. Unlike other shillelagh's this weapon uses your inner fire as its damage modifier. At tier 1, it is a masterwork 1 shillelagh. At tier 2, it is masterwork 2. And at tier 3, it is masterwork 2 and deals an additional 1d6 arcane damage.

Tier_1.name: Pathfinder
Tier_1.description: Fix your mind upon a destination you have heard of or an item have seen. So long as the object or place is in range and is not magically obscured, you immediately feel it tugging at you over the distance and know which direction to head.

Tier_2.name: Snowblind
Tier_2.description: A snowstorm swirls around you as you lift your focus aloft. The snows are incredibly heavy, and quickly cause the terrain to become difficult for everyone but your party, and light to become low.
Tier_2.upcast: You are able to spend ten minutes to reduce the cost of this spell by 1.

Tier_2.name: Wall of Thorns
Tier_2.description: At your bidding, a snarled wall of brambles bursts from the ground, sporting cruel thorns. The wall is 5 feet wide, 10 feet high, and 40 feet long.

effect.description: Anyone besides you who moves through the brambles takes damage and must make a spell power save or be Halted. On success, they are Hindered.

Tier_2.name: Maelstrom
Tier_2.description: Muttering under your breath, you stir the air with your hand. In moments, a swirling riptide or whirlwind appears at a point within range.

effect.description: Everyone within the spell's radius must make a spell power save or take damage and be pulled 15 feet towards the spell's center. Anyone within the spell's radius is Hindered.

Tier_2.name: Lightning Strike
Tier_2.description: White-hot energy fills you until you feel that you might be reduced to cinder. Just before you immolate, you direct it outward, through your focus, and towards an unlucky enemy. With a peal of thunder, lightning arcs between you and your target.

effect.description: They must make a spell power save or fall Prone.

Tier_2.name: Orb of Fire
Tier_2.description: Cup your hands about a piece of tinder and speak the words of fire to it. As it ignites, you toss it to the ground before you, and it rapidly grows to a white-hot sphere up to five feet in diameter. Each turn, you may use an action to cause the sphere to roll up to thirty feet. The sphere is capable of rolling over obstacles up to two and a half feet tall.
